text:
<@U0578M93BPE> fyi, the registration on the code committed last night works for Yumi, Eric, me and Cory so I still recommend starting clean and creating a *new* fork and cloning that down to your machine to work from.

And then when you have login ready, it should be a really seamless pull request at that point.

If you are worried about losing your current fork because you need to reference your past commits, you could *first* rename that in GitHub to something like "Old Couch Cats" and then create a new fork from our main repository to work from. (Just an idea but up to you on how you preserve your past commits to reference).

<@U057C75RYBB> As a heads up, I plan to create the Delete functionality for a user account as discussed yesterday, but I am also going to test with front end code to make sure it works seamlessly. I will then provide you with that code snippet to include on the profile page when you get to it.

Figured at this point in our timeline. that is more efficient than testing it later/relying on postman, and letting you know so we don't duplicate efforts on that specific button/functionality.

text:
<@U056Y707Y14> Regarding our convo yesterday about how the front end gets the user's unique id – I just remembered that when a user registers, I am generating a URI, which is the uniform resource identifier and includes the user's id in it, and sending that to the front end within the HTTPHeader.

But maybe it's still simpler to create a method like we talked about to retrieve the id using their email anyway, but I can do a bit more research on how the front end is supposed to consume and use the URI to see if that is already half in place or if we still need that method. I'll report back

text:
I am documenting the items we talked about specifically regarding how the states of the pages adjust based on the user's login status below. I am listing what happens when a user is logged in only since those are the updates we'd be making.

 *When a user is logged in:* 
1. Navigation bar:
    a. The Register and Login buttons are hidden from the navigation
    b. In their place are a Logout and My Profile button _(unless Eric wants the profile button somewhere else)_
2. All pages
    a. _Yumi also thought it would be a nice touch to display the user details in some way (for example, something that says "Hi First Name" -- not necessarily that but to give a bit of context, might be in nav, might not be)_
3. Home, /Search and /Movie
    a. An "Add to Watchlist" button would be present with the movies listed
4. Profile Page
    a. Can only be accessed when a user is logged in -- _Yumi is going to handle the logic to ensure that someone could never navigate to their profile page if they are not logged in and test that the backend code we have in place to validate this is working._ 
<@U056Y707Y14> no rush, but fill in any blanks I missed, and <@U057C75RYBB> <@U0578M93BPE>, please add to this thread if you think of anything else that should be adjusted based on if the user is logged in.

Feels like this might actually be one of the last things we do once we get everything else working/in place but Yumi is going to start preliminary testing/research of how to implement.
